entries.content: If you have to discount to win a deal, you're not a salesman.
Do not discount; that is not selling.
Selling is getting your fees on your terms, with both parties walking away satisfied.
entries.notes: Defines selling in contrast to discounting or negotiating.

entries.content: If you can't get your value, you're not a salesman.
entries.notes: Links sales skill to securing the full value/price.

entries.content: Prospect asks for a lower price ($150 to $110). Agreeing to the discount is not selling.

focus_area: Handling Price Objections: Reframe to ROI, "Compared to what?", breakdown strategy
